description: Nikola Petrak decides to keep the logs hidden, destroying crucial evidence from his secured briefcase and disabling restoration channels. He hopes ongoing BCI glitches will expose system flaws to the public and pressure the Council.
BCI scoring mishaps escalate citywide as more residents perform exaggerated acts of compliance, hoping to avoid random denials and score drops. The system struggles to assess genuine behavior.
A wave of synchronized public 'compliance displays' spreads through Stenograd: citizens over-perform civic duties and praise for the system, creating an atmosphere of artificial calm and unease.

Council Harmonists warn that artificial compliance is flooding data streams, making it harder to spot real risks. Innovators urge stricter behavioral analysis, while Directorate factions demand rapid intervention.

Small citizen groups begin quietly resisting, subtly introducing unpredictable behaviors to confuse BCI tracking. In response, Directorate surveillance visibly increases, fueling public mistrust and anxiety.
